Section II - Married to an Unbelieving Spouse

                 5. The Christian Spouse's Behavior 

     No Thought of Divorce. If the wife is an unbeliever and an opposer, the husband cannot, in view of the law of God, put her away on this ground alone. In order to be in harmony with the law of Jehovah, he must abide with her, unless she chooses of herself to depart.--Letter 8, 1888.
